application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Various works to 20 trees across the campus within the accompanying schedule of proposed works. All works are to reduce risks from subjecttrees to an acceptable level across the site and for general good arboricultural management.The tree works are:1294 Quercus robur Deadwood. Clear hung branch1031 Quercus robur Pollard at 5m. Leave as monolith at height4490 Quercus robur Cut back off building to provide 4m clearance.1218 Quercus robur 2-3m canopy reduction. Use coronet cuts.1216a Fraxinus excelsior Fell to 5m. Leave as monolith1231 Acer pseudoplatanus 3-4m canopy reduction1977 Larix decidua Fell to 3m. Leave as monolith427 Quercus robur Pollard to 3m4457 Salix caprea 1-2m reduction of south canopy.4119 Acer pseudoplatanus Remove hung branch837 Tilia cordata 2m reduction of lower north primary branch.4275 Quercus robur 2m reduction of north primary branch.b221 Castanea sativa Pollard at 3mb225 Salix caprea Fell to ground level2866 Quercus robur 2m reduction of north primary branch.1049 Betula pubescens Fell to 1m. Leave as monolith1052 Robinia pseudoacacia Fell to 2m. Leave as a monolith450a Robinia pseudoacacia 2-3m canopy reduction. Introduce terrace to bank400 Robinia pseudoacacia 2-3m canopy reduction. Introduce terrace to bankb293 Salix caprea Fell to 2m. Leave as monolith
decision_conditions: Any replacement trees which within a period of five years from planting are removed, die or become seriously damaged/diseased shall be replaced within the next planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) with trees of similar amenity value.Any replacement planting should be carried out with due consideration for overhead and underground services, property boundaries, buildings and potential maintenance. The eventual size of a specimen and the nature of its rooting structure should also be taken into account when choosing where to plant, in order to achieve the best result for your site.Eight of the following will be a suitable replacement species:a) Norway maple 'Crimson King' (Acer platanoides 'Crimson King')b) Norway maple (Acer platanoides)c) Goat WIllow (Salix caprea)d) Red Oak (Quercus rubra)e) European larch (Larix decidua) f) Himalayan birch (Betula utilis jacquemontii)I have to warn you that if one of the above specified replacements is not planted by the end of the first planting season (Oct 1st to April 30th) following the proposed removals, a notice may be served under section 207 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). However, I trust that such action will not be necessary and I look forward to receiving your full cooperation in this matter. Please ensure that you inform the Council's Tree Officer (james.baker@kingston.gov.uk) with the provision of a photo once the replanting has taken place.
